abstract: As the search engine restores links that it had removed to comply with a court order, its handling of the “right to be forgotten” becomes murkier.
snippet: As the search engine restores links that it had removed to comply with a court order, its handling of the “right to be forgotten” becomes murkier.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Google’s efforts to carry out a European court order on the “right to be forgotten” took another twist on Friday as the company restored search-engine links to several newspaper articles from The Guardian whose delinking had stirred a public furor only a day earlier.

headline.main: Google Reinstates European Links to Articles From The Guardian
headline.print_headline: Adapting to Privacy Ruling, Google Chooses to Hit ‘Undo’
